name: sphagnum
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
any of several different mosses (= very small green plants) that grow on wet ground and hold a lot of water. When they decay they form peat (= a dark brown substance like soil): Certain species of sphagnum may become abundant in acid water. Sphagnum moss is valued by gardeners for its ability to hold an immense amount of water. Synonym
peat moss
More examplesFewer examplesTheir typical habitat is sphagnum bogs or slow-moving meadow streams.There are extensive patches of sphagna at the top of the site.Little grows here except for these low bushes and bogs of sphagnum mosses.
